title: Dimension of vector a
text: Since the vector a ∈ $$R^3$$ , this means that the vector has three components.

title: Standard Basis Vectors
text: The e vectors denote the standard basis vectors, where all components are $$0$$ except for the nth component for $$e_n$$ that is equal to $$1$$.

title: Special Properties
text: Because only the nth component of the standard basis vector is not zero, only the coefficient of the $$x_n$$ term is kept a nontrivial value when the $$e_n$$ vector is plugged in.

title: Linear Function Properties
text: For linear functions, the nth component of the coefficient vector a is the value of the function evaluated with the nth elementary basis vector.

title: Calculating components of a
text: What is the first component of a corresponding to the function being evaluated at $$e_1$$?

title: Missing Values
text: Since the $$e_1$$ and $$e_2$$ are the only two basis vectors evaluated, the third component of a that would correspond to $$e_3$$ can be any arbitrary value $$t$$.
